comment.author: 66406516@N08
comment._content: This is Company A of the 30th Pennsylvania Infantry. It was mustered into service on June 4, 1861 and was composed of men recruited from Chester County. Its Captain, Mott Hooton, can be seen at left center leaning on his sword. His name is depicted in boughs in the company arbor visible behind his men. He will be promoted to Major and survive the war. Company A was mustered out on June 13, 1864.
